Articles.Content:
If ksp2 is going to be like the original it needs some easter eggs, so I was wondering what would be good KSP2 easter eggs.

Here are mine:
1) A burnt wheel of cheese sitting somewhere with scattered pieces of a dragon capsule around it.

2) A memorial to the KSP 1 suits near the astronaut complex.

3) Something related to HarvesteR to celebrate the person who made KSP possible.

I must confess, I'm really not a fan of some of the Easter eggs in KSP1. I'd rather have gameplay-relevant places to visit that actually lead to scientific progression and resources, or just interesting vistas that are unique to specific locations, but are plausibly-realistic. I particularly dislike the monoliths and the Neil Armstrong memorial, not because I have any dislike for the man, of course, but because they seem so out-of-place and tawdry.

44 minutes ago, Ashandalar said:

I'd rather have gameplay-relevant places to visit that actually lead to scientific progression and resources, or just interesting vistas that are unique to specific locations, but are plausibly-realistic.

Then they aren't exactly easter eggs.

Because easter eggs are exactly that - something out of place, funny and/or based on popcultural reference.
